body.name: Farberware Edgekeeper Triple Riveted Slicing Self-Sharpening Blade Cover, High Carbon-Stainless Steel Kitchen Ergonomic Handle, Razor-Sharp Knife, 8 Inch, White
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 26 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 15 hrs 45 mins
FREE pickup Monday, February 26 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 15 hrs 45 mins
features: CUTLERY ESSENTIALS: This Farberware 8-Inch Slicing Knife with a sharpening blade cover is essential for your everyday food prep tasks.

SELF-SHARPENING BLADE COVER: The EdgeKeeper protective sheath features a built-in sharpener designed to sharpen blade edges with every use. This feature ensures the blades retain their razor-sharp edge.
HIGH-QUALITY BLADE: This knife features a high-carbon, stainless steel blade which ensure the knife retains its ultra-sharp edge and making food prep effortless.
COMFORT GRIP: Ergonomically designed for a comfortable grip; this knife is designed for chopping, dicing, and mincing.

HOW TO USE: Hold the bottom of the sharpening blade cover and gently remove the knife with opposite hand. Blade edge will sharpen as knife is removed from the sleeve, as well as inserted into the sleeve.
body.description: This Farberware 8-inch white triple riveted slicing knife with self-sharpening blade cover is essential for your everyday food prep tasks. It features a high-carbon stainless steel blade that cuts with higher precision. The ergonomically designed triple riveted handle is comfortable and balanced for precise cutting tasks. The Edgekeeper blade cover features a built-in sharpener designed to sharpen blade edges with every use. To Use: Hold the bottom of the sharpening sleeve and gently remove the knife with opposite hand. Blade edge will sharpen as knife is removed from the sleeve, as well as inserted into the sleeve. Includes: 8-inch slicing knife with self-sharpening blade cover. Hand wash with warm water and a mild detergent; rinse and dry immediately; wipe protective, blade cover as needed with a damp cloth.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice feel and always sharp
reviews.reviewText: Great knife, it looks nice and cuts really well. It is really sharp, even without having to use the sharpener. Love having the cover for keeping it and my fingers protected. Including the sharpener is a good thing to have. Liked the way it feels in my hand.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Sharp and Cheap
reviews.reviewText: Disclosure: This was sent to me for free via the Vine program. I did not receive monetary compensation to write this review, just the product itself.Picked this up because I need a new "utility" knife in the kitchen that was a low profile chef's knife and this fit the bill. Straight out of the package (which was a nightmare to undo, let me tell you) it's a pretty solid knife. It's got a built in V notch sharpener in the blade sheathe and it comes pretty darn sharp so no need to get out the honing stones for this thing. It chops well enough (I ran it through some root vegetables for making soup to really test it) and it's nice and light in the hand. It feels a TINY bit cheap but that's because it is; a whopping $9 or $10 (it's currently not in stock as of 10/8/23 so I can't give you a definitive answer). It's a decent knife for a cheap price that'll really last a long time between sharpening so I can't fault it at all. Hand wash only though, which is a bummer, but dishwashing knives isn't great for them anyway. Bacchus approved.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice knife with self sharpening cover
reviews.reviewText: It's convenient to keep extra knives, especially at holidays when there is party prep and extra guests. This knife is sharp and useful for both meat and veggies. I like that it comes with its own cover, making it easier to travel with if needed. It says the case is self sharpening - time will tell.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy and Sharp Kitchen Knife
reviews.reviewText: Very nice kitchen knife, exactly as described in the product description. This has everything I was looking for. The blade is designed for meat trimming, but since I'm not a pro chef, I use it for soft veggies too like tomatoes and peppers since it's sharp and cuts well.* Sturdy and sharp blade for trimming and cutting meat.* Built in sharpener works well. The blade stays sharp, I can feel it running through the sharpener as designed.* Nice solid handle.* Sheath to store knife in, which protects fingers & blade when stored in a drawer or storage.Overall, I like it and it does its job very well. I use it as my travel knife when I cook at different kitchens (like at churches or commercial kitchens). So the sheath and sharpener are really, really nice for me, because the knife goes with me wherever I cook. It'd also be perfect for camping and deer camp. Nice innovative knife with a lot of uses.Hand wash only is recommended. No big deal, I do this anyway. I have a theory that automatic dishwaters can dull a knife edge (detergent), so I wash cooking knives by hand anyway.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Decent cheap knife but safety concern
reviews.reviewText: This is a decent cheap knife, think low priced bed bath and beyond or grocery store knife. But what concerns me is the metal doesn't go all the way through the handle, which means its easier for it to snap off and become a hazard for the user. Even plenty of cheap knife companies manufacture knives so the metal is part of the handle and its so much safer that way.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Not full tang
reviews.reviewText: This is an inexpensive, sharp knife.This knife is a lot more lightweight than I usually like. It would not be great for cutting a lot of fruit and vegetables.I usually don't like a self-sharpening anything because it wears down the edge, but this one can be inserted upside down in its cover and not sharpened after every use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Welcome Kitchen Addition
reviews.reviewText: The Farberware Edgekeeper is a versatile knife that I use for just about everything. It comes out of the box super sharp with its unique sheath. I can be certain that the sheath is actually sharpening the knife since I’ve only been using it for a few weeks, but it sure sounds good when I sheath the knife to that whetstone sound.The knife is lightweight and fits well in my hand. My wife particularly likes it with it being nimbler than our other chef’s knives. I always hand wash my prep knives, so the required hand washing of this knife doesn’t bother me.I like this knife and am glad it has joined my kitchen knife repertoire.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars SELF-SHARPENING KNIFE - THAT’S A NOVEL CONCEPT
reviews.reviewText: I’m all for sharp knives. Did you know that sharp knife is safer than a dull one? Yea, that’s something I learned in Boy Scouts. A sharp knife cuts like it supposed to while a dull knife slips and requires excessive pressure which leads to you getting hurt.This is the first time I’ve ever heard of a self-sharpening knife. In case you have not figured it out, there’s a small sharpener in the sheath. Thus, every time you put it back in the sheath, you are sharpening it.Personally, I prefer serrated knives. The downside to a serrated knife is that it’s impossible to sharpen. Thus, you end up throwing it out. The advantage to this knife is that it potentially last much longer since it’s constantly kept sharp.PROS: - Long blade - Blade is sharp - Self-sharpening - Attractive design - Good handle grip - Sturdy constructionCONS: - Hand wash only (no dishwasher) and then hand dryOverall, this knife cuts well, appears to be well-made, and if it can keep itself sharp, that’s a bonus. I hope it lasts a long time.
